alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:31PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, southwestern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado and western Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado through 615 PM MDT... At 530 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles west of Elba to 6 miles northwest of Arriba to 6 miles southeast of Hugo to near Forder. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Flagler. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 390 and 419. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
